inputPorts.description: Information about the asset's input ports.

outputPorts.description: Information about the asset's output ports.

metadata.description: If the asset is a custom module, this holds the module's metadata.

parameters.description: If the asset is a custom module, this holds the module's parameters.

AssetItem.description: Information about an asset associated with the web service.

uri.description: The URI where the asset is accessible from, (e.g. aml://abc for system assets or https://xyz for user asets

credentials.description: Access credentials for the asset, if applicable (e.g. asset specified by storage account connection string + blob URI)

AssetLocation.description: Describes the access location for a web service asset.

format.description: Additional format information for the data type.

enum.description: If the data type is categorical, this provides the list of accepted categories.

x-ms-isnullable.description: Flag indicating if the type supports null values or not.

x-ms-isordered.description: Flag indicating whether the categories are treated as an ordered set or not, if this is a categorical column.

ColumnSpecification.description: Swagger 2.0 schema for a column within the data table representing a web service input or output. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

id.description: The commitment plan ARM resource  id.

CommitmentPlan.description: Information about the machine learning commitment plan associated with the web service.

level.description: Level of tracing to be used: None - disables tracing; Error - collects only error (stderr) traces; All - collects all traces (stdout and stderr).

expiry.description: Moment of time after which diagnostics are no longer collected. If null, diagnostic collection is not time limited.

DiagnosticsConfiguration.description: Diagnostics settings for an Azure ML web service.

inputs.description: Sample input data for the web service's input(s) given as an input name to sample input values matrix map.

globalParameters.description: Sample input data for the web service's global parameters

ExampleRequest.description: Sample input data for the service's input(s).

sourcePortId.description: The identifier of the source node's port that the edge connects from.

targetPortId.description: The identifier of the destination node's port that the edge connects into.

GraphEdge.description: Defines an edge within the web service's graph.

assetId.description: The id of the asset represented by this node.

inputId.description: The id of the input element represented by this node.

outputId.description: The id of the output element represented by this node.

parameters.description: If applicable, parameters of the node. Global graph parameters map into these, with values set at runtime.

GraphNode.description: Specifies a node in the web service graph. The node can either be an input, output or asset node, so only one of the corresponding id properties is populated at any given time.

nodes.description: The set of nodes making up the graph, provided as a nodeId to GraphNode map

edges.description: The list of edges making up the graph.

graphParameters.description: The collection of global parameters for the graph, given as a global parameter name to GraphParameter map. Each parameter here has a 1:1 match with the global parameters values map declared at the WebServiceProperties level.

GraphPackage.description: Defines the graph of modules making up the machine learning solution.

links.description: Association links for this parameter to nodes in the graph.

GraphParameter.description: Defines a global parameter in the graph.

parameterKey.description: The identifier of the node parameter that the global parameter maps to.

GraphParameterLink.description: Association link for a graph global parameter to a node in the graph.

MachineLearningWorkspace.description: Information about the machine learning workspace containing the experiment that is source for the web service.

interfaceString.description: The interface string name for the nested parameter.

modeValuesInfo.description: Definitions for nested interface parameters if this is a complex module parameter.

ModuleAssetParameter.description: Parameter definition for a module asset.

maxConcurrentCalls.description: Maximum number of concurrent calls allowed on the realtime endpoint.

RealtimeConfiguration.description: Holds the available configuration options for an Azure ML web service endpoint.

type.description: The type of the entity described in swagger. Always 'object'.

properties.description: Map of name to swagger schema for each input or output of the web service.

ServiceInputOutputSpecification.description: The swagger 2.0 schema describing the service's inputs or outputs. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

StorageAccount.description: Access information for a storage account.

type.description: The type of the entity described in swagger.

properties.description: The set of columns within the data table.

TableSpecification.description: The swagger 2.0 schema describing a single service input or output. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

WebServiceKeys.description: Access keys for the web service calls.

title.description: The title of the Azure ML web service.

description.description: The description of the Azure ML web service.

keys.description: The set of access keys for the web service. If not specified at creation time (PUT), they will be generated automatically by the resource provider.

readOnly.description: If true, the web service can no longer be updated / patched, only removed. Otherwise, the service resource supports changes.

exposeSampleData.description: Flag that controls whether to expose sample data or not in the web service's swagger definition.

realtimeConfiguration.description: Configuration for the service's realtime endpoint.

diagnostics.description: Settings controlling the diagnostics traces collection for the web service.

storageAccount.description: The storage account associated with the service. This is used to store both datasets and diagnostic traces. This information is required at creation time (PUT) and only the key is updateable after that. The account credentials are hidden on a GET web service call.

machineLearningWorkspace.description: This is only populated at creation time (PUT) for web services originating from an AzureML Studio experiment.

commitmentPlan.description: The commitment plan associated with this web service. This is required to be specified at creation time (PUT) and is not updateable afterwards.

input.description: Swagger schema for the service's input(s), as applicable.

output.description: Swagger schema for the service's output(s), as applicable.

exampleRequest.description: Sample request data for each of the service's inputs, as applicable.

assets.description: Set of assets associated with the web service.

parameters.description: The set of global parameters values defined for the web service, given as a global parameter name to default value map. If no default value is specified, the parameter is considered to be required.

package.description: The definition of the graph package making up this web service.

WebServiceProperties.description: The set of properties specific to the Azure ML web service resource.
